newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan central bank won't cut reserve requirements.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan central bank won't cut reserve requirements.

text.p: Taiwan's central bank had no plan to cut banks' reserve requirements at its Thursday afternoon board meeting, bank governor Sheu Yuan-dong told a parliament session on Thursday.

"According to my advisers and my personal understanding...we feel this is not the right time to lower banks' reserve requirements," Sheu told lawmakers before the bank's scheduled board meeting around 0700 GMT.
His comments were boardcast in state radio.
The bank will hold a news conference around 0930 GMT.
"But it does not mean we will not cut reserve requirements in the future," Sheu said.
Sheu added lowering banks' reserve requirements was the central bank's policy.
Analysts have expected the bank would reiterate its long-standing "stable-to-loose" monetary policy after the meeting.
